newsitem.title: NIGERIA: Nigeria jails nine airforce officers for fraud.
newsitem.headline: Nigeria jails nine airforce officers for fraud.

text.p: Nine Nigerian airforce officers were sentenced to prison terms ranging from three to 50 years for embezzling 63 million naira ($787,500) of public funds, state radio reported on Tuesday.
A court martial sentenced the officers from the airforce finance unit on Monday, ending the trial that began in July on more than a dozen counts of corruption.
Among the nine, wing commander Leo James faces 50 years in prison and the former head of the finance unit, group captain Raymond Tinglocha is to serve 49 years.
They were accused of systematically stealing airforce funds and were ordered to refund a total 167.7 million naira ($2 million) to the government.
"They are a clique of hard, merciless criminals who nearly brought the Nigeria Airforce to its knees," said court martial president air commodore Victor Akiti.
"While the nation and the airforce were in gross neglect as a result of lack of funds, these officers were dancing in obscene wealth," Akiti added while passing judgment.
Nigeria's military government has said it would pass a decree to bring to book hundreds of current and former officials found to have stolen from public enterprises.
